New Records: Rhys Hoskins tied the franchise record for grand slams in a season with his third in 2024.
Milwaukee Brewers reached 10 grand slams in a single season, matching a franchise record.
Brice Turang tied the franchise record for steals in a season with 50 steals in 2024.
Key Match Events: Rhys Hoskins hit a grand slam in the first inning, giving the Brewers an early 4-0 lead.
The Mets trailed 5-0 before Mark Vientos hit a two-run homer in the third inning.
The Brewers improved to 11-1 in their last 12 games against the Mets, including a 4-0 record this year.
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets were chasing the National League wild cards and needed to win to stay in contention.
Francisco Lindor returned from a injury and played in his first game in over a week.
Post-Match Reflections: Mets manager Carlos Mendoza praised the team's resilience after the loss.
Francisco Lindor expressed pride in the team's effort and determination.
Brice Turang discussed the importance of the win for the Brewers' playoff preparation.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Milwaukee Brewers' playoff hopes were strengthened with the win.
The Mets' playoff chances were impacted by the loss.
Rhys Hoskins continued to be a key player for the Brewers against the Mets.
